meanings.definition: To calibrate (a measuring instrument) by comparing it with another instrument.
meanings.sent1: Scientists intercalibrate the new thermometer with the old one to ensure accurate readings.
meanings.sent2: It is important to intercalibrate the scales of the two microscopes for precise measurements.
meanings.sent3: The robots decided to intercalibrate their sensors during their break time.
meanings.sent4: The dancers intercalibrated their movements to perform a flawless routine.
meanings.sent5: The chefs intercalibrated their cooking timers to coordinate the perfect meal timing.

meanings.definition: The act of calibrating two or more instruments by comparing their measurements.
meanings.sent1: The intercalibration of the speedometers revealed a slight discrepancy in the readings.
meanings.sent2: Accurate scientific results depend on the intercalibration of the various measuring devices.
meanings.sent3: The intercalibration of the clocks turned into a fun competition among the technicians.
meanings.sent4: The intercalibration of the compasses ensured the hikers stayed on the right path.
meanings.sent5: The intercalibration of the thermometers was crucial for the experiment's success.
